sentences: Dylan Brody (born April 24, 1964) is a U.S. humorist, playwright, author and comedian.
In 2005 his play Mother May I won the Stanley Drama Award.
He has appeared on A&E's Comedy on the Road and Fox TV's Comedy Express and has written for Jay Leno's Tonight Show monologue.
His novel Laughs Last, a semi-autobiographical story about a young standup comedian, was released in 2013 to strong acclaim from both critics and other comedians.
He has also written a martial art comedy film, "Kimchi Warrior".
Brody lives in Los Angeles with his wife.
